definitions.definition: To allow to be used by someone temporarily , on condition that it or its equivalent will be returned .
examples: I will only lend you my car if you fill up the tank.
Where is that hundred euros I lent you months ago?

definitions.definition: To be suitable or applicable , to fit .
examples: Poems do not lend themselves to translation easily.
The long history of the past does not lend itself to a simple black and white interpretation.

definitions.definition: To afford; to grant or furnish in general.
examples: Can you lend me some assistance?
The famous director lent his name to the new film.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To allow to be used by someone temporarily , on condition that it or its equivalent will be returned .
secondary_definitions: ( reflexive ) To be suitable or applicable , to fit .
To afford; to grant or furnish in general.
